repnme.cdata!:
Salvador - Public Finance and Social
            Progress Development Policy Loan Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Public Finance and
            Social Progress Development Policy Loan (DPL) Project for
            Salvador were as follows: outcomes were moderately
            satisfactory; risk to development outcome was moderate; Bank
            performance was satisfactory and borrower performance was
            moderately satisfactory. Some lessons learned includes:
            sustaining the dialogue on macroeconomic performance and the
            program of reforms were critical for the outcome of a DPL.
            Sustained engagement developed knowledge and helped the Bank
            to respond with flexibility to a changing country context.
            This DPL was one of the first DPLs to successfully support a
            gender reform agenda. Political risks materialized during
            implementation which made it difficult to achieve
            expenditure and revenue targets.

docna.cdata!:
Salvador - Public Finance and Social
            Progress Development Policy Loan Project

Salvador - Public Finance and
            Social Progress Development Policy Loan Project

14807821.majtheme: Public sector governance,Social dev/gender/inclusion,Social protection and risk management

repnme.cdata!:
El Salvador - Public Finance and Social
            Progress Development Policy Loan Project : summary of discussions

abstracts.cdata!:
The Executive Directors approved the
            Public Finance and Social Progress Development Policy Loan
            (DPL) to the Republic of El Salvador in the amount of US$100
            million on the payment terms and conditions set out in the
            President's Memorandum (R2011-0112). Directors
            expressed support for the DPL and acknowledged its focus on
            creating fiscal space for social expenditures and enhancing
            the protection and inclusion of vulnerable groups. They
            noted that the Bank's support is critical following the
            2009 crisis that hit El Salvador's economy and set back
            the social progress achieved in previous years. Looking
            ahead and noting uncertainties for growth and deficits,
            Directors highlighted the importance of tax system reforms.
            Directors welcomed the consultative and participatory manner
            in which the program was prepared. Finally, aid coordination
            and continued consultations and consensus building to
            facilitate the implementation of the program were also encouraged.

docna.cdata!:
El Salvador - Public Finance and Social
            Progress Development Policy Loan Project : summary of discussions

repnme.cdata!:
El Salvador - Public Finance and Social
            Progress Development Policy Loan Program

abstracts.cdata!:
The objectives of the Public Finance and
            Social Progress Development Policy Loan Program for El
            Salvador are creating fiscal space for needed social
            expenditure by supporting actions to increase tax revenues
            and to improve efficiency and transparency in the allocation
            of public resources; Protecting and including vulnerable
            segments of the population by allocating additional public
            resources towards social programs targeting vulnerable
            groups such as the elderly, women, and children in poor
            areas. This program document describes a Development Policy
            Loan (DPL) in the amount of US$100 million to the republic
            of El Salvador. The operation is the first in a series of
            two loans. The series builds on the progress achieved under
            the Public Finance and Social Sector (PFSS) DPL (January,
            2009) and Sustaining Social Gains for Economic Recovery
            Program (SSGER) DPL (November, 2009). It reflects the
            government's priority of achieving fiscally and
            economically sustainable social progress. The operation is
            rooted in the Country Partnership Strategy (CPS) for El
            Salvador. The DPL series has been identified in the 2009 CPS
            as an instrument for providing continued support to the
            policy areas covered by the previous DPLs, such as fiscal
            reform, public sector management, and the protection of
            vulnerable populations. The operation is fully consistent
            with the CPS's guiding principle of supporting
            government efforts to mitigate the fiscal impact of the
            crisis while addressing longer-term development challenges.

El Salvador - Public Finance and Social
            Progress Development Policy Loan Program
